meanings.definition: The basic monetary unit of Mozambique.
meanings.sent1: In Mozambique, you can buy many things with just one metical.
meanings.sent2: I exchanged my dollars for meticals at the bank.
meanings.sent3: The metical in my pocket felt like a lucky charm.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was worth more than a thousand meticals.
meanings.sent5: The shiny metical sparkled in the sunlight.

meanings.definition: A unit of currency in Mozambique.
meanings.sent1: The price of the item was listed in meticals.
meanings.sent2: I need to withdraw some meticals from the ATM.
meanings.sent3: I found a metical on the ground and thought I was rich.
meanings.sent4: His words carried more weight than any amount of meticals.
meanings.sent5: The sound of meticals clinking together was music to my ears.

meanings.definition: Relating to or denoting the currency of Mozambique.
meanings.sent1: She collected metical coins as souvenirs from her travels.
meanings.sent2: The metical banknotes had unique designs on them.
meanings.sent3: His outfit had a metical theme, with colors of the Mozambican flag.
meanings.sent4: The value of friendship is more precious than any metical possession.
meanings.sent5: The metical market was bustling with activity and traders.
